Taichi: Ah! Something nice must've happened, huh? I see how it is. Maybe you're the fisherman, and you caught someone? You snagged a bouncy, fresh fish for yourself? Shuuji: No, I haven't! Could you stop teasing me first thing in the morning? That's messed― Shuuji: Oh... Give me a moment. I got a text. Shuuji: I've hardly ever used them before, so I don't have a clue what I'm doing― Taichi: Heh... *grin* Shuuji: Ah?! I-It's not like that, Dad! Taichi: Don't worry about me, Son. You meeting up with someone? Or are you having lunch together? Shuuji: Ugh... A-Anyway, I'm sorry but I gotta go now! I'll do the laundry after school, so just leave it be for now! Taichi: Sure. See you later. And good luck! Meguru: Ah! Senpai! Helloha! Shuuji: Pheew... G-Good morning. Meguru: You're breathing pretty heavily. Did you run all the way here? Shuuji: N-No, I didn't. Meguru: Ahaha... Yeah, I just felt like it when I woke up this morning. Meguru: And Senpai, what was up with that emoticon...? Pfft, that made it seem like you were all flustered. Shuuji: Oh, yeah... My bad, Inaba-san. I wanted to use one since you did, but I don't know jack about emoticons... Meguru: ...... Shuuji: H-Huh? Inaba-san? Meguru: *stare* Shuuji: Inaba―Ah! Shuuji: Sorry! Umm... Meguru. Meguru: That's right! I almost thought you forgot already. Meguru: But I'll forgive you since you remembered in the end. Let's go, Senpai! Shuuji: ...Huh? We're going this way again? Meguru: Of course. This way has just become that kinda way for us, you know? Shuuji: That kinda way...? You mean like, a way just for us, so we can talk? Meguru: Haha, actually saying that out loud is so lame. Shuuji: It's really hard to get what sets you off and what doesn't, you know that?! Meguru: I don't know what you're talking about. Meguru: ...Umm, by the way, Senpai. Shuuji: Huh? Wh-What's up? Meguru: You know, there's actually something I'd like to ask of you. That's partly why I texted you. Shuuji: Yeah? What is it? Meguru: You remember how I told you all that stuff on the way home last Friday? Shuuji: Ah... Shuuji: Huh? You mean... Meguru: Umm... From Nene-senpai and the others, I mean. Shuuji: Huh? Go on... Meguru: How do I put this... More importantly than that... Meguru: I just, well... I only want you to know. Shuuji: ...... Meguru: I'm not really sure why myself... Ahaha, yeah... Shuuji: ...Got it. I'll keep it to myself. Meguru: Ah... Shuuji: (I mean, even putting that aside...) Shuuji: (...Sorry, Meguru. I know I just promised you, but...) Shuuji: Yeah, thanks. Shuuji: Well, the thing is... Shuuji: (Do you two know anyone who could search for someone?) Shuuji: (Yeah. I'm trying find someone who went missing.) Nene: (...Is this somehow related to Inaba-san's fragments?) Tsumugi: (Oh, right. Ayachi-san told me about that. That's why you've been so concerned with Meguru-chan lately, right?) Shuuji: (Yeah... That's right.) Shuuji: (I'll give you the details later, but it seems like she her best friend disappeared and she doesn't know where she is.) Tsumugi: (...Really?) Shuuji: (She left without saying goodbye... I think the incident left her scarred. Now I want to find that friend of hers.) Tsumugi: (Oh... She went through all that?) Nene: (...Okay. I understand.) Nene: (I don't know anyone with people finding skills, but I'll at least ask who I can for now.) Tsumugi: (Oh, I'll help out too. Not just because of the fragments. I want to help Meguru-chan.) Shuuji: (Thanks. I really appreciate it.) Tsumugi: (Also, is it okay to tell Togakushi-senpai about this too? She knows a lot of people, so she could be really helpful.) Shuuji: (Yeah, would be great if you could. I can definitely see her being a big help.) Tsumugi: (I'm sure she will! Okay, I'll ask her.) Shuuji: (But one more thing. I would like you to keep this all from her for now.) Nene: (...Why is that?) Shuuji: (Umm... The truth is, she asked me to keep it a secret. Said she doesn't want anyone but me to know since it's embarrassing to her.) Tsumugi: (Oh?) Shuuji: (Besides, we might not be able to find the girl. I don't want to disappoint her or anything. So I'd really appreciate it if you kept quiet about this until we know more.) Nene: (...Alright. Understood.) Tsumugi: (But... Hey, Ayachi-san. This is definitely how I think it is, right?) Nene: (I think so. I can't see it any other way.) Shuuji: (...Huh? What're you talking about?) Tsumugi: (Ahaha, you can be so dense about this stuff.) Tsumugi: (Isn't it obvious? Meguru-chan actually―) Meguru: Excuse me! Tsumugi: Ah?! Meguru: Oh, you're all together! Meguru: Do you really have to ask? I came to hang out. Meguru: Alright! Don't mind me. Meguru: Hey, Nene-senpai, Tsumugi-senpai! I've come over to chat! Shuuji: ...... Tsumugi: H-Huh? With us, you mean? Meguru: You bet. We haven't seen each other or talked since Friday. Meguru: Oh, I'm not bothering you by coming, am I? Tsumugi: N-No! Not at all. Meguru: Ahaha, great! I'm happy to hear that. Nene: Is it okay to ignore Hoshina-kun like that, though? Shuuji: Huh? O-Oh, uh... Meguru: (...! ...!) Tsumugi: I'm pretty sure he didn't say anything... Meguru: Senpai, Senpai. You don't mind, do you? Shuuji: Nah, it's okay, Meguru. If you've come to see the two of them, then I'll let you guys be. Nene, Tsumugi: ...... Meguru: No one said you had to go away or anything. You can stay and watch in silence. Shuuji: Isn't this just bullying?! Meguru: Not at all! I'm just asking you to kindly watch over me. Shuuji: Ugh... Okay, enough with the puppy-dog eyes, Meguru. Meguru: What's the matter? Please watch over me, Senpai! Hideaki: Uh, excuse me. Comment from the peanut gallery, here. Meguru: Huh?! Wh-What the! Wh-Wh-What is it?! Hideaki: Okay, so... Ahem. Hideaki: Isn't Shuuji the only one you're chatting with?! Meguru: Ah... Wakana: Ah, sorry for butting in. I'm Kariya Wakana, and this guy is Kaidou Hideaki. We're Hoshina's friends. Meguru: O-Oh! I'm Inaba Meguru. Wakana: Anyway... Ahem. Wakana: Hoshina, since when have you been calling her by her first name without honorifics?! Shuuji: Ah... Tsumugi: Yes! That's right! I was just thinking that! Nice one, Kariya-san! Nene: So was I. I think we all were wondering about that. Up until now, he has been calling her by her last name with an honorific... Meguru: Ah, er, umm, about that, it's like...! Meguru: Huh? Ah, er... Shuuji: We've become pretty good friends, so I asked if I could start using her first name. Shuuji: And, well, a plain and simple "Meguru" without honorifics is what felt right to me, so I just went with that. Hideaki: Huh... I see. Gotta say, that's not like you. Shuuji: Yeah, you're not wrong. But I've never had a junior in a club before, so... Wakana: It didn't feel right treating her like an underclassman forever? Kinda like how they do it in sports clubs. Didn't know you had that side to you, Hoshina. Shuuji: Is there something wrong with that? It's not like this girl holds anything back like a typical underclassman. Wakana: Yeah, I can see that. She seems kinda over-familiar... Oh, sorry, I didn't mean that in a bad way. She just seems quite attached with how she's all "Senpai, Senpai!" Nene: So nothing special happened between you two that led to you calling her by her first name? Tsumugi: That's kind of a bummer... Shuuji: Y-Yeah, nothing special happened! Right, Meguru? Meguru: Huh?! D-Dat's right! Shuuji: Anyway, isn't it about time for you to head back to your classroom? Lunch break is almost over. Meguru: Ah... Oh yeah! I'll do that! Meguru: I-I'm leaving then! See you all later! Meguru: So I thought, next time I should have you come over to my place instead. Shuuji: I can't turn you down when you put it like that. Shuuji: Well, we're both ditching club for the day to do this... Meguru: But Nene-senpai said that it was okay. Shuuji: Yeah, I guess. Shuuji: (......) Shuuji: (I'm trying my best to ignore that delicious bittersweet taste from earlier.) Shuuji: Huh, you live pretty close to the station. Meguru: We could have passed through the shopping district to get to my place too, but I thought it'd be better to take a route that's easier to remember. Shuuji: ...Does that mean there is going to be a second time? Meguru: Why do you always have to ask these things out loud? Seriously, Senpai... Man. Shuuji: Wh-What's so bad about it? That's just how important it is. Meguru: O-Oh, it's important? Shuuji: Sure is. At least to me. Meguru: ...You don't ever change, do you? Shuuji: What's that supposed to mean? Meguru: Ah, we have to turn the corner here. Shuuji: Oh... Meguru: We're there. This is my house. Shuuji: Huh? Sure... Meguru: I'm baaack! Shuuji: It's about damn―Bueeh?! Shuuji: ...... Meguru: Senpai, you should see the look on your face right now. Shuuji: I mean, it didn't even cross my mind that you'd make me wait just to change again... Meguru: I like to kick back and relax at home, so I went ahead and changed into something more comfortable. Shuuji: Then why didn't you come to meet me in those clothes?!  Meguru: Because this way I get to surprise you. I knew you'd never expect me to change a second time. Shuuji: This was seriously all part of your plan? You sure went out of your way... Meguru: Really, though, this is loungewear. I can't wear this stuff outside. Meguru: So, what do you think? Surprised? Shuuji: Yeah, I really didn't expect you to change a second time. Though, your new getup is surprising too. You give off a completely different vibe than usual in that outfit. Meguru: That's right. Hehe. That surprise you too? Well, you had no way of knowing since I never told you. Meguru: Do the glasses make a big difference?  Shuuji: Hmm... They do make you look more plain than usual. Meguru: This is how I always looked before entering Himematsu. Shuuji: ...You mean, before your makeover? Meguru: Yep! Standing before you is an elusive Meguru that hardly anyone else gets to see. Meguru: It's gotten kinda embarrassing to show myself in public like this now. I look way too plain. I don't want to come off as a slob. Shuuji: ...But you're okay looking like this in front of me? Meguru: Hehehe. I'm making an exception for you. Your reactions are worth it! Meguru: I'd like you to keep this a secret as well. Shuuji: Y-Yeah, sure... Shuuji: That's a pretty sweet weapon, but I'm a lance player. Not like getting that gun would do me any good. Meguru: What the heck? Why aren't you jealous?! Meguru: Well, whatever. I know you'll think differently after Lavie here saves your butt with her shiny new weapon.  Shuuji: Guh. Well, yeah, I'm pretty much relying on you to carry me... as always... Shuuji: Gotta say, though. Playing with each other while sitting face-to-face is a completely different experience. Meguru: Right? This way you won't get horrifically murderized when you try to thank me! Shuuji: You didn't have to bring that up again, Lavie-san! Meguru: Sorry, but it was too funny. I don't think I'll ever forget how you just stopped and got your face kicked in. Shuuji: I was actually moved by how skilled yet kind the mysterious Lavie-san was... I was shocked when I saw who was behind the character. Meguru: What the heck? I'm not any different from Lavie! Just look at how good she is at coordinating her outfit. Shuuji: Can't deny that. That armor set is pretty dang cool. Meguru: I know, right?! I had to do so much grinding to get the whole set. Hehe! Shuuji: The hair and armor colors even match. It's kinda hot, or more like sexy... Nice job. Meguru: How could you say that to the person playing the character? Gross. Shuuji: I was just trying to compliment your fashion sense, since you seem to take pride in that... Meguru: Ugh... Meguru: Th-Then you should say that about me instead. Shuuji: Huh? Meguru: Don't "huh" me! What's with that answer? Don't you want to compliment me? Meguru: Lavie's player is, umm... confident about her own fashion as well... Shuuji: Oh, you look pretty sexy too. Meguru: Buh?! Wh-Wh-Wh-What're you saying?! Shuuji: Well, just look at how you're always showing off your legs... Meguru: M-M-Maybe, but... we're talking about my fashion sense! Not my legs! Shuuji: But going with bare legs is an intentional decision, isn't it? That's a conscious fashion choice. Meguru: Okay, true! But still! Ahh, geez! Shuuji: When I first saw you at school, I thought you looked like a bit of a floozy. But on closer inspection, it's really more of a casual cute style. Meguru: ...... Shuuji: I can tell you put some serious thought into picking a jumper that would match with your uniform. You give off a vibrant, playful vibe, like that of a younger girl. It's really fitting for you. Meguru: Y-Yeah? Ehehe, I spent a lot of time coordinating that outfit. It's my pride and joy♪ Meguru: Senpai, Senpai, praise me more! Shuuji: Sorry, but that's all I got. I'm having trouble remembering anything else to say from the fashion magazines I flipped through... Meguru: ...There goes most of the goodwill you just garnered. Shuuji: You're pretty easy to flatter, huh? Meguru: And there goes the rest. Shuuji: Sorry, I went a little too far there... Meguru: Whatever. Let's just go and do a quest. Shuuji: Oh, okay... I guess I'll back you up... Meguru: Pfft, haha... You don't have to act so depressed. Shuuji: Ah, you cheering up again? Meguru: Geez, I don't believe you. Yeah, I'll cheer up and shoot you full healing bullets～ Shuuji: Huh? Did you make these just for me...? Meguru: No, I made them yesterday. I was just in the mood for it. Shuuji: Ah... Still, though. Thanks. I'll dig right in. Meguru: Yeah, go ahead! Shuuji: ...Oh, this is great! It's sweet and sour, but also has a slightly bitter aftertaste. I really like it. Meguru: Oh, awesome! Meguru: Hearing everyone's impression is the best part of making any dessert. Shuuji: No, really, you're seriously good at this. Every treat of yours I've eaten has been delicious. Shuuji: You're a pretty good cook in general, aren't you? Like in MonHun, you've got quite a few hidden talents. Meguru: Oh, thank... Well, umm... Meguru: I guess you could say I'm a bit of a homebody. I tend to spend most of my free time at home. Shuuji: Oh, I see. That makes sense... Meguru: Yeah, basically. Shuuji: What kind of books do you like? The genres on your shelf seem all over the place. Meguru: Good question... I don't have specific preferences. I read pretty much everything. Shuuji: Huh... Got any examples? Meguru: The last thing I read was an Irish poem collection. Before that was some celebrity's street food travelogue, and before that an isekai harem light novel, I think? Shuuji: Holy crap, that spread... You'll read just about anything, huh? Meguru: Lately though I've been playing games a lot more than reading. I play stuff other than MonHun too. Shuuji: Yeah, I see the console. Oh... l-looks like you're into otome games. Meguru: Heck yeah. With headphones on! Those sexy male voices make my heart pound in ways that― Meguru: Wait, how did you know?! Shuuji: Err, there's what looks like one laying out in the open over there... Meguru: Huh?! Aaah! I-I forgot to put it awaaay! Shuuji: I-It's okay! I play that kinda stuff too! Meguru: What?! You're a guy who plays otome games?! Shuuji: No, I tend to play games aimed at guys... Meguru: For guys...? Y-You mean porn games? Ugh, you actually play that filth? You're the worst... Shuuji: What an absurd double standard. Don't just assume that any visual novel for guys is an adult PC game! There's a lot of perfectly normal stuff on consoles! Shuuji: Wait, why do you even know about those kinds of games...? Meguru: Uhh... Shuuji: You actually play those, don't you?! Meguru: I-I do not! How dare you suggest that?! I've had enough of your super-perv antics! Shuuji: Don't pretend like you're not accusing me of the same thing! This is such a double standard! Shuuji: No, thank you. For the tart, and― Meguru's Mom: Oh my, you're going home already? Meguru: Wha?! Shuuji: Oh, uh, yes! Thanks for having me! Meguru: M-Mom!! Why did you come out?! Meguru's Mom: This is the first friend you've brought over in so long. Of course I'd want to say hello! Meguru's Mom: And it's a boy too? How exciting! Meguru: Geez! I thought I told you to stay clear! Besides, you're getting the wrong idea! Meguru: It's not like you think! He's just an upperclassman from my club! Meguru's Mom: Thank you for taking care of my daughter. Ahh, I wish my husband was here to see you too... Meguru: Mooom! Geeez! Shuuji: Er, I really need to go now! You'll have to let me off for today! Thanks again! Shuuji: ...... Nene: Huh? Is that you, Hoshina-kun? Shuuji: Oh... Hey there, Ayachi-san. On your way home? Nene: Yes. The sun was setting, so we called it a day. Nene: Weren't you supposed to be somewhere with Inaba-san? Shuuji: Yeah, but we called it a day for the same reason. Nene: I see... Shuuji: Yeah... Nene: ...... Nene: I've got some news, Hoshina-kun. Shuuji: Ah... Wh-What is it? Nene: It seems that Togakushi-senpai is willing to help us. Shuuji: Huh? You mean... Nene: About Inaba-san's missing friend. Shuuji: ...... Nene: Since Inaba-san's friend was her classmate, Togakushi-senpai said she would get in touch with some people she knows from the schools near their old one and have them check the student registers there. Shuuji: I see... Nene: ...Hoshina-kun? Shuuji: Yeah... Meguru: "I'd like you to keep this a secret as well." Shuuji: (But if there's a thorn still stuck in her heart, I want to remove it for her.) Shuuji: "W-Well, yeah... We do..." Meguru: "So I feel a certain kinship with you." Shuuji: Are you free right now? This would be a good time for me to share the details.
